abstract: Rep Carolyn B Maloney, Democrat of New York, shares details of letters she sent to five federal agencies responsible for writing Volcker Rule requesting they provide nearly two years of metrics they have accumulated on bank behavior; says data could show if changes are working as intended and reducing risky bank actions.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Representative Carolyn B. Maloney requested two years of information that could help inform the debate over the rule’s impact on the financial system.
snippet: Representative Carolyn B. Maloney requested two years of information that could help inform the debate over the rule’s impact on the financial system....

headline.main: Congresswoman Presses Regulators on Volcker Rule Data
headline.print_headline: Congresswoman Asks for Trading Data Collected Under Volcker Rule
